t: Jeremiah 5
Not One Is Upright

“Go*pn up and down the streets of Jerusalem, look*ld around and consider, search*ld through her squares. If*ln you can find but one person who*ld deals honestly and seeks the truth, I*ld will forgive this city.
Although*ln they say, ‘As surely as the Lord*s lives,’ still*ld they are swearing falsely.”

Lord,*spn do not your eyes look for truth? You*ld struck them, but they felt no pain; you*ld crushed them, but they refused correction. They*ln made their faces harder than stone and*ld refused to repent.
I*ln thought, “These are only the poor; they*ld are foolish, for*ln they do not know the way of the Lord,*s the*ld requirements of their God.

So*ln I will go to the leaders and*ld speak to them; surely*ln they know the way of the Lord,*s the*ld requirements of their God.” But*ln with one accord they too had broken off the yoke and*ld torn off the bonds.

Therefore*ln a lion from the forest will attack them, a*ld wolf from the desert will ravage them, a*ln leopard will lie in wait near their towns to*ld tear to pieces any who venture out, for*ln their rebellion is great and*ld their backslidings many.

“Why*pn should I forgive you? Your*ld children have forsaken me and*ld sworn by gods that are not gods. I*ln supplied all their needs, yet*ld they committed adultery and*ld thronged to the houses of prostitutes.
They*ln are well-fed, lusty stallions, each*ld neighing for another man’s wife.
Should*ln I not punish them for this?” declares*ld the Lord.*s “Should*ln I not avenge myself on*ld such a nation as this?
“Go*pn through her vineyards and ravage them, but*ld do not destroy them completely. Strip*ln off her branches, for*ld these people do not belong to the Lord.*s
The*ln people of Israel and the people of Judah have*ld been utterly unfaithful to me,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
They*pn have lied about the Lord;*s they*ld said, “He will do nothing! No*ln harm will come to us; we*ld will never see sword or famine.
The*ln prophets are but wind and*ld the word is not in them; so*ld let what they say be done to them.”
Therefore*p this is what the Lord*s God Almighty says: “Because*pn the people have spoken these words, I*ld will make my words in your mouth a fire and*ld these people the wood it consumes.

People*ln of Israel,” declares the Lord,*s “I*ld am bringing a distant nation against you— an*ln ancient and enduring nation, a*ld people whose language you do not know, whose*ld speech you do not understand.
Their*ln quivers are like an open grave; all*ld of them are mighty warriors.

They*ln will devour your harvests and food, devour*ld your sons and daughters; they*ln will devour your flocks and herds, devour*ld your vines and fig trees. With*ln the sword they will destroy the*ld fortified cities in which you trust.
“Yet*p even in those days,” declares the Lord,*s “I will not destroy you completely.

And when the people ask, ‘Why has the Lord*s our God done all this to us?’ you will tell them, ‘As you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your own land, so now you will serve foreigners in a land not your own.’
“Announce*pn this to the descendants of Jacob and*ld proclaim it in Judah:
Hear*ln this, you foolish and senseless people, who*ld have eyes but do not see, who*ld have ears but do not hear:

Should*ln you not fear me?” declares the Lord.*s “Should*ld you not tremble in my presence? I*ln made the sand a boundary for the sea, an*ld everlasting barrier it cannot cross. The*ln waves may roll, but they cannot prevail; they*ld may roar, but they cannot cross it.
But*ln these people have stubborn and rebellious hearts; they*ld have turned aside and gone away.
They*ln do not say to themselves, ‘Let*ld us fear the Lord*s our God, who*ln gives autumn and spring rains in season, who*ld assures us of the regular weeks of harvest.’
Your*ln wrongdoings have kept these away; your*ld sins have deprived you of good.
“Among*pn my people are the wicked who*ld lie in wait like men who snare birds and*ld like those who set traps to catch people.
Like*ln cages full of birds, their*ld houses are full of deceit; they*ln have become rich and powerful
and*ld have grown fat and sleek. Their*ln evil deeds have no limit; they*ld do not seek justice. They*ln do not promote the case of the fatherless; they*ld do not defend the just cause of the poor.
Should*ln I not punish them for this?” declares*ld the Lord.*s “Should*ln I not avenge myself on*ld such a nation as this?
“A*pn horrible and shocking thing has*ld happened in the land:
The*ln prophets prophesy lies, the*ld priests rule by their own authority, and*ln my people love it this way. But*ld what will you do in the end?
